item.title: My Hard coded Enum Fletching Class
item.dc:creator: @I_Smoke_Kush I Smoke Kush
item.description:
@I_Smoke_Kush wrote:

jummppy:

I personally doubt you have written this. I have looked through it over and over again. If you have written this. You would of released all of it. I don’t see two methods that should be inside this class. SHAFT() {}, and BowAndBoltData(){}. You would of realized that you would need to set these variables to zero again once it checks through everything, and preforms what is needed to preform. You also wouldn’t need these inside player.java public StringingData stringingData; and the booleans are always false on start, so no need to declare them false. Also why recopy these ints from player.java and the class private int materialId1. And the last thing. This isn’t running anywhere else that you have showed us, like through the itemOnItem packet. So it wouldn’t run at all.

I personally don’t care about your opinion.

Read full topic
item.source: My Hard coded Enum Fletching Class
